body: I understand that `kwargs` shows up in the other RNN implementations, but is there a reason it is done this way? It seems safer to explicitly list the arguments, so that if someone adds a new argument they will notice the symbolic needs to be updated.
body_html: I understand that kwargs shows up in the other RNN implementations, but is there a reason it is done this way? It seems safer to explicitly list the arguments, so that if someone adds a new argument they will notice the symbolic needs to be updated.
